children.text: The window glazing rubber/bead is not in the correct location, which looks poorly finished and may allow water and air ingress.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 8.02 Weather-tightness of windows, doors, and window and door frames states that
‘Windows and doors are defective if, when closed, they allow the entry of water’

. Additionally, Part 3.12.3.3 and Part 3.12.3.5 of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) calls for all gaps around windows and doors to be sealed. Australian Standard AS 2047 also calls for the sealing of windows/doors to stop water and air penetration.
This glazing rubber/bead will need to be properly installed prior to handover.
